subject: Basketball
lead_paragraph: The former University of Connecticut star Asjha Jones signed a three-year contract extension with the W.N.B.A.’s Connecticut Sun. Terms of the deal, which was announced Wednesday, were not released. Jones, a 6-foot-2 forward in her fifth season with the Sun, leads the team in scoring at almost 17 points a game. The Sun (16-10) leads the Eastern Conference and will resume its season Aug. 28 at Indiana after the league’s Olympic break.
